subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Grit: Why Persistence Beats Talent
description: A short lesson to help you apply Grit: Why Persistence Beats Talent.

hook.text: Angela Duckworth studied West Point cadets. The best predictor of survival wasn't fitnessâ€”it was grit.

buildup.text: Grit is the combination of passion and perseverance for long-term goals, even when progress is invisible.

discovery.text: Duckworth found grit predicts success better than IQ, talent, or social intelligence in nearly every field.

twist.text: But grit without direction is just stubbornness. Knowing when to pivot is as important as persevering.

climax.text: Slack took 8 years from first idea to product-market fit. Butterfield's grit outlasted two failed games.

punchline.text: Talent gets you noticed. Grit gets you there.

quiz.question: What does Angela Duckworth's research say about grit?
options: It predicts success better than IQ or talent across nearly all domains
Gritty people never change direction or pivot
Grit is a fixed personality trait present from birth
